title: Classic Beef Stew
summary: This Classic Beef Stew is a hearty and flavorful meal. One serving contains 450 calories, 28g of protein, and 20g of fat. For $2.50 per serving, this recipe covers 30% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 4. A mixture of beef, carrots, potatoes, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so delicious. 350 people have tried and liked this recipe. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 2 hours. Taking all factors into account, this recipe earns a spoonacular score of 90%, which is excellent.
instructions: 1. Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. 2. Add the beef and cook until browned. 3. Add onions, carrots, and celery and cook until vegetables are tender. 4. Stir in potatoes, beef broth, tomato paste, and thyme. 5. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer for 1.5 hours or until beef is tender. 6. Season with salt and pepper to taste. 7. Serve hot.

title: Vegetarian Tacos with Avocado Cream
summary: These Vegetarian Tacos with Avocado Cream are a quick and delicious meal. One serving contains 350 calories, 12g of protein, and 22g of fat. For $1.20 per serving, this recipe covers 25% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 4. A mixture of black beans, avocado, corn tortillas, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so tasty. 178 people have tried and liked this recipe. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 30 minutes. Taking all factors into account, this recipe earns a spoonacular score of 85%, which is outstanding.
instructions: 1. In a medium bowl, mash the avocado with lime juice and salt until smooth. 2. In a skillet over medium heat, heat the olive oil. 3. Add the black beans, corn, and spices, and cook until heated through. 4. Warm the tortillas in a separate skillet. 5. Assemble the tacos by placing a spoonful of the bean mixture on each tortilla and topping with avocado cream and fresh cilantro. 6. Serve immediately.

instructions: 1. In a blender, combine the blueberries, banana, almond milk, and honey. 2. Blend until smooth. 3. Pour into glasses and serve immediately.

title: Chocolate Cake
summary: This Chocolate Cake is rich and moist. This recipe serves 12 and contains 350 calories, 5g of protein, and 15g of fat per serving. For $1.50 per serving, this recipe covers 8% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This dessert takes approximately 60 minutes to prepare and cook. 500 people have tried and liked this recipe. It is brought to you by delicious.com.
instructions:
Chocolate Cake:
Preheat oven and prepare baking pans as needed.
In a large bowl, cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the vanilla extract.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, and salt.
Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients alternately with the milk and boiling water, mixing just until incorporated after each addition.
Pour batter into prepared pans.
Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Allow cakes to cool completely before frosting.

title: Blueberry Muffins
summary: Blueberry Muffins are a delightful breakfast treat. This recipe serves 12 and contains 200 calories, 4g of protein, and 8g of fat per serving. For $0.75 per serving, this recipe covers 8% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This dessert takes approximately 45 minutes to prepare and cook. 210 people have tried and liked this recipe. It is brought to you by allrecipes.com.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). Grease a 12-cup muffin pan or line with paper liners. In a large bowl, mix together the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt. In another bowl, beat the egg, then add the milk and oil, mixing well. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix just until combined. Fold in the blueberries. Fill muffin cups about 2/3 full. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean. Let cool in the pan for 10 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

title: Chicken Schnitzel
summary: Chicken Schnitzel is a popular main course. This recipe serves 4 and contains 480 calories, 28g of protein, and 22g of fat per serving. For $3.00 per serving, this recipe covers 20% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This dish takes approximately 40 minutes to prepare and cook. 190 people have tried and liked this recipe. It is brought to you by seriouseats.com.
instructions: Pound the chicken breasts to an even thickness. Season with salt and pepper. Set up a breading station with flour, beaten eggs, and breadcrumbs. Dredge the chicken in flour, dip in eggs, then coat with breadcrumbs. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Fry the chicken until golden brown and cooked through, about 3-4 minutes per side. Drain on paper towels. Serve with lemon wedges.
